question: Did you set up your Java development environment with Java 17 or later, and a build tool (Maven 3.5+ or Gradle 7.5+)?
Have you tried creating your first Spring Boot project using Spring Initializr (either via the website or IDE integration)?
Did you successfully run your first Spring Boot application and see “Greetings from Spring Boot!” in the browser or using curl?
Did you add and run a basic unit test for the HelloController endpoint?
Which annotation is commonly used to define a bean in Spring?
What is the process of identifying a dependency, finding a matching bean, and injecting it into another bean called?
If multiple beans of the same type are available and @Autowired is used without specifying which one to use, what will Spring do?
options: Use the bean with the earliest creation time

question: Which statement best describes Inversion of Control (IoC)?
options: The application controls when and how dependencies are created
The framework controls the creation and injection of dependencies
The user manually wires dependencies using XML files
The JVM controls the execution of beans
correctAnswer: The framework controls the creation and injection of dependencies

question: Which IoC container does Spring recommend using in most applications?
Create a simple Spring Boot project where a Car class depends on an Engine class. Use @Component and @Autowired to demonstrate dependency injection, and print a message from Engine when Car starts.
expectedOutcome: When running the application, Spring should automatically inject Engine into Car and display the message from the injected engine instance.
